013package org.apache.juneau.junit.bct;
014
015import java.util.*;
016import java.util.concurrent.*;
017import java.util.function.*;
018
019/**
020 * Collection of standard swapper implementations for the Bean-Centric Testing framework.
021 *
022 * <p>This class provides built-in object transformation strategies that handle common wrapper
023 * types and asynchronous objects. These swappers are automatically registered when using
024 * {@link BasicBeanConverter.Builder#defaultSettings()}.</p>
025 *
026 * <h5 class='section'>Purpose:</h5>
027 * <p>Swappers pre-process objects before stringification or listification, enabling the converter
028 * to handle wrapper types, lazy evaluation objects, and asynchronous results consistently. They
029 * transform objects into more primitive forms that can be easily converted to strings or lists.</p>
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Built-in Swappers:</h5>
032 * <ul>
033 *    <li><b>{@link #optionalSwapper()}</b> - Unwraps {@link Optional} values to their contained objects or <jk>null</jk></li>
034 *    <li><b>{@link #supplierSwapper()}</b> - Evaluates {@link Supplier} functions to get their supplied values</li>
035 *    <li><b>{@link #futureSwapper()}</b> - Extracts completed {@link Future} results or returns status messages</li>
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>Usage Example:</h5>
039 * <p class='bjava'>
040 *    <jc>// Register swappers using builder</jc>
041 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
042 *       .defaultSettings()
043 *       .addSwapper(Optional.<jk>class</jk>, Swappers.<jsm>optionalSwapper</jsm>())
044 *       .addSwapper(Supplier.<jk>class</jk>, Swappers.<jsm>supplierSwapper</jsm>())
045 *       .addSwapper(Future.<jk>class</jk>, Swappers.<jsm>futureSwapper</jsm>())
046 *       .build();
047 * </p>
048 *
049 * <h5 class='section'>Custom Swapper Development:</h5>
050 * <p>When creating custom swappers, follow these patterns:</p>
051 * <ul>
052 *    <li><b>Null Safety:</b> Handle <jk>null</jk> inputs gracefully</li>
053 *    <li><b>Exception Handling:</b> Convert exceptions to meaningful error messages</li>
054 *    <li><b>Status Indication:</b> Provide clear status for incomplete or error states</li>
055 *    <li><b>Non-blocking:</b> Avoid blocking operations that might hang tests</li>
056 *    <li><b>Recursion Prevention:</b> Ensure swappers don't create circular transformations that could lead to {@link StackOverflowError}.
057 *        The framework does not check for recursion, so developers must avoid registering swappers that transform objects
058 *        back to types that would trigger the same or other swappers in an endless cycle.</li>
059 * </ul>
060 *
061 * @see Swapper
062 * @see BasicBeanConverter.Builder#addSwapper(Class, Swapper)
063 * @see BasicBeanConverter.Builder#defaultSettings()
064 */
065@SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
066public class Swappers {
067
068   /**
069    * Constructor.
070    */
071   private Swappers() {}
072
073   /**
074    * Returns a swapper for {@link Optional} objects that unwraps them to their contained values.
075    *
076    * <p>This swapper extracts the value from Optional instances, returning the contained object
077    * if present, or <jk>null</jk> if the Optional is empty. This allows Optional-wrapped values
078    * to be processed naturally by the converter without special handling.</p>
079    *
080    * <h5 class='section'>Behavior:</h5>
081    * <ul>
082    *    <li><b>Present value:</b> Returns the contained object for further processing</li>
083    *    <li><b>Empty Optional:</b> Returns <jk>null</jk>, which will be rendered as the configured null value</li>
084    * </ul>
085    *
086    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
087    * <p class='bjava'>
088    *    <jc>// Test Optional with value</jc>
089    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>optional</jv> = Optional.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Hello"</js>);
090    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>optional</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"Hello"</js>);
091    *
092    *    <jc>// Test empty Optional</jc>
093    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>empty</jv> = Optional.<jsm>empty</jsm>();
094    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>empty</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>);
095    *
096    *    <jc>// Test nested Optional in object</jc>
097    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>user</jv> = <jk>new</jk> User().setName(Optional.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"John"</js>));
098    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"name"</js>, <js>"John"</js>);
099    * </p>
100    *
101    * <h5 class='section'>Integration:</h5>
102    * <p>This swapper is particularly useful when working with modern Java APIs that return
103    * Optional values. It allows test assertions to focus on the actual data rather than
104    * Optional wrapper mechanics.</p>
105    *
106    * @return A {@link Swapper} for {@link Optional} objects
107    * @see Optional
108    */
109   public static Swapper<Optional> optionalSwapper() {
110      return (bc, optional) -> optional.orElse(null);
111   }
112
113   /**
114    * Returns a swapper for {@link Supplier} objects that evaluates them to get their supplied values.
115    *
116    * <p>This swapper calls the {@link Supplier#get()} method to obtain the value that the supplier
117    * provides. This enables testing of lazy-evaluated or dynamically-computed values as if they
118    * were regular objects.</p>
119    *
120    * <h5 class='section'>Behavior:</h5>
121    * <ul>
122    *    <li><b>Successful evaluation:</b> Returns the result of calling {@link Supplier#get()}</li>
123    *    <li><b>Exception during evaluation:</b> Allows the exception to propagate (no special handling)</li>
124    * </ul>
125    *
126    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
127    * <p class='bjava'>
128    *    <jc>// Test supplier with simple value</jc>
129    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>supplier</jv> = () -&gt; <js>"Hello World"</js>;
130    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>supplier</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"Hello World"</js>);
131    *
132    *    <jc>// Test supplier in object property</jc>
133    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>config</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Configuration().setDynamicValue(() -&gt; calculateValue());
134    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>config</jv>, <js>"dynamicValue"</js>, <js>"computed-result"</js>);
135    *
136    *    <jc>// Test supplier returning null</jc>
137    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>nullSupplier</jv> = () -&gt; <jk>null</jk>;
138    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>nullSupplier</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>);
139    * </p>
140    *
141    * <h5 class='section'>Important Notes:</h5>
142    * <ul>
143    *    <li><b>Side Effects:</b> The supplier will be evaluated during conversion, which may cause side effects</li>
144    *    <li><b>Performance:</b> Expensive computations in suppliers will impact test performance</li>
145    *    <li><b>Exception Handling:</b> Exceptions from suppliers are not caught by this swapper</li>
146    * </ul>
147    *
148    * @return A {@link Swapper} for {@link Supplier} objects
149    * @see Supplier
150    */
151   public static Swapper<Supplier> supplierSwapper() {
152      return (bc, supplier) -> supplier.get();
153   }
154
155   /**
156    * Returns a swapper for {@link Future} objects that extracts completed results or status information.
157    *
158    * <p>This swapper handles {@link Future} objects in a non-blocking manner, providing meaningful
159    * information about the future's state without waiting for completion:</p>
160    *
161    * <h5 class='section'>Behavior:</h5>
162    * <ul>
163    *    <li><b>Completed successfully:</b> Returns the actual result value</li>
164    *    <li><b>Completed with exception:</b> Returns <js>"&lt;error: {message}&gt;"</js> format</li>
165    *    <li><b>Cancelled:</b> Returns <js>"&lt;cancelled&gt;"</js></li>
166    *    <li><b>Still pending:</b> Returns <js>"&lt;pending&gt;"</js></li>
167    * </ul>
168    *
169    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
170    * <p class='bjava'>
171    *    <jc>// Test completed future</jc>
172    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>future</jv> = CompletableFuture.<jsm>completedFuture</jsm>(<js>"Hello"</js>);
173    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>future</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"Hello"</js>);
174    *
175    *    <jc>// Test pending future</jc>
176    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>pending</jv> = <jk>new</jk> CompletableFuture&lt;String&gt;();
177    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>pending</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"&lt;pending&gt;"</js>);
178    *
179    *    <jc>// Test cancelled future</jc>
180    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>cancelled</jv> = <jk>new</jk> CompletableFuture&lt;String&gt;();
181    *    <jv>cancelled</jv>.cancel(<jk>true</jk>);
182    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>cancelled</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"&lt;cancelled&gt;"</js>);
183    *
184    *    <jc>// Test failed future</jc>
185    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>failed</jv> = <jk>new</jk> CompletableFuture&lt;String&gt;();
186    *    <jv>failed</jv>.completeExceptionally(<jk>new</jk> RuntimeException(<js>"Test error"</js>));
187    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>failed</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>, <js>"&lt;error: Test error&gt;"</js>);
188    * </p>
189    *
190    * <h5 class='section'>Non-blocking Guarantee:</h5>
191    * <p>This swapper never calls {@link Future#get()} without first checking {@link Future#isDone()},
192    * ensuring that test execution is never blocked by incomplete futures. This makes it safe to use
193    * in unit tests without risking hangs or timeouts.</p>
194    *
195    * <h5 class='section'>Error Handling:</h5>
196    * <p>When a future completes exceptionally, the swapper extracts the exception message and
197    * formats it as <js>"&lt;error: {message}&gt;"</js>. This provides useful debugging information
198    * while maintaining a consistent string format for assertions.</p>
199    *
200    * @return A {@link Swapper} for {@link Future} objects
201    * @see Future
202    * @see CompletableFuture
203    */
204   public static Swapper<Future> futureSwapper() {
205      return (bc, future) -> {
206         if (future.isDone() && !future.isCancelled()) {
207            try {
208               return future.get();
209            } catch (Exception e) {  // NOSONAR
210               return "<error: " + e.getMessage() + ">";
211            }
212         }
213         return future.isCancelled() ? "<cancelled>" : "<pending>";
214      };
215   }
216}
